meanings.definition: Below the normal or average level in intelligence or development.
meanings.sent1: The student had a subnormal IQ compared to his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The child's subnormal growth concerned the pediatrician.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the subnormal squirrel trying to solve a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her subnormal understanding of the situation made it difficult for her to make a decision.
meanings.sent5: The subnormal performance of the computer frustrated the user.

meanings.definition: Less than normal in amount, size, or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The subnormal rainfall this year led to drought conditions in the region.
meanings.sent2: The subnormal number of attendees at the event was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the subnormal amount of ice cream left in the tub.
meanings.sent4: The subnormal brightness of the stars made it difficult to navigate without a compass.
meanings.sent5: The subnormal volume of the music made it hard to hear the lyrics clearly.
